result.execSummary:
The defendant Benny Angelo Houston was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Hearing 2/18/15.
**March 5, 20015  to Zulfigar B.  in amount of $2,618.73 as previously ordered by Br. 30.  To be paid from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance to be paid while on Extended supervision.  Failure to pay would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant.

Pay restitution, DNA surcharge and all costs and disbursements for counts 1-3.  Failure to pay amounts in full would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant.  Monies to be taken from prison funds not to exceed 25% and to be taken by DOC. Balance to be paid while on Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay amounts in ful would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain employment.  Be given job and vocational training.

No contact with 5 Star Ethnic Foods at 5004 W. Center Street, Milwaukee, WI.
No contact with Zulviger B.
No contact with 8632 N. 107 Street, Milwaukee, WI.
No controlled substances other than those legally presribed for defendant by a duly licensed physician for his mental or physical needs. Take as prescribed and for only as deemed medically necessary.
No alcohol.
AODA assessment, treatment, if needed.  Urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample unless previously provided.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess firearms, and that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to count one.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to count two.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Benny Angelo Houston

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Decision and Order Denying Request to Stay Restitution, filed and signed by the Judge.  The defendant's request to stay restitution is denied.  Copies forwarded to parties.
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Stephanie G. Rothstein, Br. 25, for review. jbs
/from Mr. Houston to the court asking court to stay rsetitution until released from prison.
amended per restitution which was ordered.

Defendant Benny Angelo Houston in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Benny Angelo Houston in custody and appears by video.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statements by the State defense counsel and defendant, who does not object to restitution amount requested.  Court ordered defendant to pay restitution to Zulfigar B., in the stipulated amount of $2,618.73, as previously ordered by Branch 20:  from up to 25% of prison funds, with the balance to be paid while on Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant.

Filed,
Attached invoices submitted on behalf of the victim.
Restitution hearing on March 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Benny Angelo Houston not in court, defendant in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared on behalf of DeAnn L. Heard for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel in another court; case was set at 9:00 a.m. and it is now 9:20 a.m.; institution cannot wait much longer.  Therefore, Court ordered case adjourned for restitution hearing before Branch 20.  Restitution hearing scheduled for March 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
Box 645; items 6 and 13 in gated area
cf
Restitution Worksheet, filed.
Request for payment of $17 witness fees for witness Zulfigur B. processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26177310 in court 1x on 12/2/14.
Request for payment of $17 witness fees for witness Suhayb A. processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26177309 in court 1x on 12/1/14.
Request for payment of witness fees prepared by the DA's Victim/Witness Services dated 12/15/14 for Suhayb A. for 1 appearance on 12/1/14; Zulfigur B. for 1 appearance on 12/2/14.
/filed.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Benny Angelo Houston in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Benny Angelo Houston in custody.  Deann L. Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case recalled.   At the hour of 11:10 a.m., the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdicts of GUILTY of Counts 1, 2 and 3 which were then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted State's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction, and advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess firearms and that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing before Branch 20 on 1/15/15 at 8:30 a.m.

Defendant Benny Angelo Houston in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Benny Angelo Houston in custody.  Deann L. Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant continues to wear prison clothing instead of civilian clothing; Court noted same rulings as to defendant's courtroom attire and silence.  Juror #15 contacted the court to advise that he had been in an accident and would be arriving late.  Court held sidebar with both counsel.  Court advised that parties have stipulated to allowing juror #15 to be the alternate juror in this case.  Jury management notified of same.  Jury back in box.  Trial continues.  Sworn for the State:  City of Milwaukee Police Officer Gerald Kulwich; Ms. Nancy Napier, Forensic Scientist, DNA Analyst - Senior.  Exhibits #34 - #45 offered and received.  State rests, subject to rebuttal.  Jury out of box.  Defense motion for directed verdict at close of State's case denied by the court.  Court attempted to have colloquy with defendant regarding his right to testify and his right not to testify.  Defendant stands mute.  Court finds that defendant does not wish to testify at this time, due to his non-communication.  Jury back in the box.  Defense rests.  Testimony closed.Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by State and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Jury retired at the hour of 10:27 a.m. to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Joann Karczewski and Thomas Antkowski who were duly sworn for that purpose.

Defendant Benny Angelo Houston in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Benny Angelo Houston in custody.  Deann L. Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Record made as to defendant once again refusing to wear street clothes; Court's ruling remains the same as on 12/01/14.  Defense counsel also advised the court that his client remains mute; same ruling stands as was made on 12/01/14.  Jury in box.  Trial resumes.  Sworn for the State:  City of Milwaukee Police Officer Shariar Solati,  City of Milwaukee Police Sergeant Michael Lassanske, Mr. Alan Winter, Forensic Investigator, Milwaukee Police Department; Mr. David Wagoner, Latent Print Examiner, Milwaukee Police Department.   Exhibits #5 - #19 offered and received.  Exhibits #9 - #12, #15, #17, #18 and #19  published to the jury.  At the hour of 11:15 a.m., the Court excused the jurors and instructed them to return to Branch 20 by 1:30 p.m., as the Court has a conditions release hearing that needs to proceed. Jury out of box.  Trial to resume at 1:30 p.m.

Defendant Benny Angelo Houston in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Benny Angelo Houston in custody.  Deann L. Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case recalled.   Court advised defendant that jury clothes have been provided by his attorney for his use at trial.  Court advised defendant that it would be in his best interest to wear street clothes instead of jail clothing.  Defendant stands mute.  Offer placed on the record by the State.  Defense counsel also advised the Court that his client has not talked to him thru the pendency of this case, in jail over the weekend or in back in the bullpen today.  Court notes same for the record.  Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  11:45 a.m.  At the hour of 12:00 p.m., the Court excused the jury panel for the noon hour with instructions to return by 1:15 p.m.  Jury out of box.    

Later same day.  Same appearances.  Jury panel back in box at 1:30 p.m.  Voir dire continues.  Jurors #27, #5, #7, #8, #10, #18, #22, #23 #24 struck for cause and discharged from further service on this jury; all were returned to Jury Management.  Jurors remaining on the first panel were allowed a break while the new jurors were brought into court; remaining jurors on first jury panel out of box.  Court ordered an additional ten (10) jurors from Jury Management.  Jurors #31 thru #40 in court in box.  Voir dire begins of the additional jurors; the first panel was then returned to the courtroom to continue with voir dire with all jurors present. Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, Wisconsin were qualified to serve as jurors in the above-entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed..  Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by State and defense.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the State:  Mr. Suhayd A.  Exhibits #1, #2, #3 and #4 offered and received; published to the jury.  At the hour of 4:46 p.m, the court excused the jurors for the evening with instructions to return by 8:30 a.m.  Jury out of box.  Record made as to administrative strikes.  Defense counsel also made a record to the fact that his client remained mute and did not speak to him during voir dire or during cross-examination of first witness.  Court noted same for the record.  Court in recess until 12/02/14 at 8:30 a.m.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Benny Angelo Houston not in court, in custody.  Deann L. Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties advise that this case remains in trial posture.  Deputies advised the Court that defendant is refusing to wear jury clothes and wants to appear in his jail clothing.  Court to have colloquy with defendant before jury panel brought over.
/submitted by defense counsel, received and filed.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Benny Angelo Houston not in court, in custody.  Deann L. Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel advised that this case remains in trial posture.
State's Proposed Witness List, received and filed.

Attorney Stephen A Sargent in court, defendant Benny Angelo Houston not in court, in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel waived his client's appearance.  Parties held sidebar with the Court.  State's motion to adjourn the trial was granted by the Court.  Case remains in trial posture; defendant in custody serving a sentence and has a pending drug charge in Branch 44.  Court ordered case continued before Branch 20.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for December 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defense counsel requested a trial date.  Any motions must filed by 5/20/14; response due by 6/09/14; reply due by 6/16/14.    All motions in limine, witness lists and jury instructions must be filed one week prior to the final pretrial date, and any alibi defenses must be filed per statute.  Final pre-trial  and motion hearing is scheduled for July 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Benny Angelo Houston in court with attorney Stephen A Sargent.  Defendant Benny Angelo Houston in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel; defendant stood mute; Information read into the record by the State.  Court ordered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant who continued to stand mute.
Original Transcript PRELIMINARY HEARING  (24 pages) commencing APRIL 10, 2014 received and filed.

Defendant Benny Angelo Houston in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Benny Angelo Houston in custody.  
Deann L. Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Michael Fedel-MPD Officer.  Exhibits 1-3 were marked, offered and received into evidence.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading.  Exhibits are ordered withdrawn.  Arraignment scheduled for April 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defense Counsel is summoned to another Court for testimony of a client in a Homicide Jury Trial.
Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Continued Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.

Defendant Benny Angelo Houston in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Benny Angelo Houston in custody.  Deann L. Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  ADA Heard reads the complete criminal complaint.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Arguments heard as to bail.  Court set bail at $10,000.00 CASH.

Defendant Benny Angelo Houston in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Benny Angelo Houston in custody.  Deann L. Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court inquired of defendant as to whether or not he believes he is competent to proceed.  Defendant stands mute.  Competency hearing proceeds.  Sworn for the State:  Dr. John Pankiewiczy, Ph.D.  Parties stipulate to his expertise and qualifications to qualify him as an expert.  Exhibits #1 and #2 offered and received.  State rests.  Court has colloquy with defendant regarding his right to testify and his right not to testify.  When asked if he understood his rights, defendant again stood mute.  Defense rests as it had no other witnesses.  Arguments heard.  The Court finds that defendant IS COMPETENT to proceed and finds that defendant has a right to remain silent.  Court ordered proceedings reinstated.  State moves to withdraw Exhibits #1 and #2.  So ordered by the Court.  Court ordered case continued for preliminary hearing before Branch PE on 4/02/14 at 1:30 p.m.

Defendant Benny Angelo Houston in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Benny Angelo Houston in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Hearing held on return on doctor's report.  Court inquired of defendant as to whether or not he agrees with the findings in the doctor's report.  Defendant stood mute.  Court ordered case adjourned for competency hearing before Branch 20.  Dr. Pankiewicz's Office contacted to obtain court date.  Parties all agree to set the matter for 3/27/14 at 10:00 a.m.  Competency hearing scheduled for March 27, 2014 at 10:00 am.
/received and filed. rn

Defendant Benny Angelo Houston in court with attorney Darryl E Smith.  Defendant Benny Angelo Houston in custody.  Janet Claire Protasiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause, suspended proceedings and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge MORONEY, Branch 20.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for March 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
